heroParagraph: Bologna as a living lab to understand what makes a climate shelter effective, how it intersects with urban fragility, and how TALEA can support planning decisions.

csiSectionTitle: Where climate shelters are and how they work
csiSectionSubtitle: Not all parks are climate shelters: here we see quality (CSI), amenities and accessibility of Bologna’s green spaces.

cfiSectionTitle: Climatic and social fragility by neighbourhood
cfiSectionSubtitle: The most fragile areas combine heat exposure, lack of climate shelters and socio-economic vulnerability. Here we see how these factors overlap in urban space.
cfiHint: Hover over statistical areas to read CFI (climatic fragility), overall F and HF. Use the slider to balance the reading between thematic layer and base map.
cfiVsCsiHint: Each point is a statistical area: in the upper-left you find zones with high climatic fragility and low-quality shelters — natural candidates for TALEA interventions.
fragilityClassHint: The class distribution shows how climatic fragility contributes to pushing neighbourhoods towards higher risk levels.
cfiAreasTableSubtitle: The table lists statistical areas and their fragility indices: click on a name to centre the map on the selected zone.
cfiAreasTableHint: Sort by overall fragility to quickly identify priority neighbourhoods, and compare with CFI to understand how much heat drives that fragility.
indicatorsSectionSubtitle: Some indicators are technical: here is a short reading guide to connect numbers, maps and operational choices.
indicatorsCSI: CSI (Climate Shelter Index) – measures how well a green area works as a climate shelter, combining shade, vegetation, water and accessibility. Values close to 1 indicate very effective shelters.
indicatorsCFI: CFI (N_f_clim) – share of overall fragility driven by heat: the higher it is, the more a zone suffers from extreme heat compared to other factors.
indicatorsF: F (N_frag2) – synthetic index of climatic and social fragility by statistical area: it combines exposure, vulnerability and response capacity.
indicatorsGreenBlue: Green % / Blue % – percentage of surface covered by vegetation or water in each area, key elements to mitigate urban heat islands.
indicatorsHotCold: Hot / Cold area % – share of territory experiencing particularly high or more mitigated temperatures compared to the surrounding urban context.
indicatorsAccess: Access and services – indicators such as bus stops within 5 minutes, benches, picnic tables and surface (ha) help understand how usable a shelter really is for the population.
infoModalIntro: This page uses TALEA project data to show, through interactive maps and charts, how climate shelters and urban fragility are distributed across Bologna and how this can inform adaptation decisions.
infoModalSourceSat: satellite and climatic data (e.g. LST) to identify urban heat islands and temperature differences between areas.
infoModalSourceLulc: land use and land cover datasets (green, water, artificial surfaces) to measure the availability of green and blue areas.
infoModalSourceSoc: socio-demographic and vulnerability indicators (density, age structure, socio-economic conditions) at statistical area level.
infoModalSourceAccess: data on public transport, stops, infrastructures and park amenities (benches, picnic areas, etc.), including open data and OpenStreetMap.
infoModalCSI: summarises how well an individual green space works as a climate shelter, combining vegetation, shade, water and accessibility.
infoModalCFI: share of overall fragility driven by heat, used to understand to what extent an area’s risk is driven by extreme temperatures.
infoModalF: synthetic index of climatic and social fragility by statistical area, combining exposure, vulnerability and response capacity.
infoModalGBHC: percentages of green, blue and particularly hot or mitigated areas, describing the “climatic composition” of neighbourhoods.
infoModalAccess: indicators such as bus stops within 5 minutes, benches, picnic tables and surface (ha), which help assess how usable a shelter really is.

infoModalBullet2: Use tables to filter and sort parks and areas based on key indicators.
infoModalBullet3: Use charts to read distributions and quickly compare CSI, CFI and overall fragility.
